main event: On the night of 2 November 1957, several motorists reported seeing a large, bright, mysterious object between Levelland and Lamesa, Texas. Some automobiles reportedly stalled in the presence of the object.
interesting points: Several vehicles reportedly experienced motor and light malfunctions in the presence of the strange object.
The object was described as oval or egg-shaped, approximately 200-300 feet in diameter, and glowing with a brilliant orange or reddish-orange color.
Observers reported a tingling sensation or 'static electricity' effect in the vicinity of the object.
The object was observed to be hovering at a height of 20-50 feet above the ground, and moved in a horizontal direction at a slow rate of speed, estimated at 10-15 mph.
The Air Force investigation considered this incident to be of significant interest due to the close-range observation of an Unidentified Flying Object made under apparently reliable conditions.
